path_1.title: The Happiest Guy in the World (2018)
path_1.feeling: Quirky human-interest portrait I found mildly engaging but a bit thin.

path_1.title: Lost World: Jurassic Park, The (1997)
path_1.feeling: Serviceable creature thrills, less my thing but entertaining enough.

path_1.title: Ratatouille (2007)
path_1.feeling: Charming and polished, though it never fully swept me away.

path_1.title: Tom Thumb (1958)
path_1.feeling: Sweet old-fashioned whimsy that felt dated for me.

path_1.title: Gremlins (1984)
path_1.feeling: Mischief and mayhem are fun in parts, but the tonal goofiness wore on me.

path_1.title: Mystic River (2003)
path_1.feeling: Grim, well-acted tragedy that pulled me in despite some heaviness.

path_1.title: Pink Ribbons, Inc. (2011)
path_1.feeling: Provocative and necessary critique that kept me wary and engaged.

path_1.title: Rocky (1976)
path_1.feeling: Inspirational and earnest, if a bit conventional for my taste now.

path_1.title: Twilight Zone: The Movie (1983)
path_1.feeling: Uneven but intriguingly Twilight Zone in spirit

path_1.title: Angel Heart (1987)
path_1.feeling: Sultry, unsettling mystery vibe that I really dig.

path_1.title: Omen, The (1976)
path_1.feeling: Atmospheric and ominous, effective yet not deeply affecting.

path_1.title: The Body (2012)
path_1.feeling: Slick, twisty suspense that scratched my mystery itch.

path_1.title: Meet Joe Black (1998)
path_1.feeling: Languid and glossy

path_1.title: Interstellar (2014)
path_1.feeling: Ambitious, thoughtful sci-fi with big ideas that outweighed its bloat.

path_1.title: Fashion Victim (2008)
path_1.feeling: Chilling subject matter delivered competently, if a bit flat.

path_1.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding (2002)
path_1.feeling: Warm and affable, but the broad comedy only half-lands for me.

path_1.title: Family Romance, LLC (2019)
path_1.feeling: Fascinating blurring of performance and reality that lingered with me.

path_1.title: From One Second to the Next (2013)
path_1.feeling: Sober, empathetic testimonies that hit hard without fuss.

path_1.title: St. Vincent (2014)
path_1.feeling: A modest charmer with some heart amid the shtick.

path_1.title: Pursuit of Happyness, The (2006)
path_1.feeling: Uplifting and earnest, a bit sentimental but sincere.

path_1.title: Rocky Horror Picture Show, The (1975)
path_1.feeling: Bold and campy, but the kitsch only intermittently works for me.

path_1.title: Evolution (2001)
path_1.feeling: Goofy alien hijinks that mostly missed my sense of humor.

path_1.title: The Place (2017)
path_1.feeling: Moral-bargain parables that felt intriguingly Twilight Zone-adjacent.

path_1.title: The Perfect Human Diet (2012)
path_1.feeling: Slick but overconfident

path_1.title: Roxanne (1987)
path_1.feeling: Clever and amiable, if ultimately lightweight for me.

path_1.title: Mad Adventures of Rabbi Jacob, the (Les Aventures de Rabbi Jacob) (1973)
path_1.feeling: Energetic farce that’s more exhausting than hilarious for me.

path_1.title: Lonely Boy (2013)
path_1.feeling: Sensitive and sincere portrait that held my attention.

path_1.title: What the Health (2017)
path_1.feeling: Punchy advocacy that raised flags for me, even as parts were compelling.

path_1.title: Space Cowboys (2000)
path_1.feeling: Old-pro space romp that’s pleasant but forgettable.

path_3.feeling: Loud and busy creature thrills with little to chew on afterward.

path_3.title: Tom Thumb (1958)
path_3.feeling: Pleasantly old-fashioned but too sugary and slight for me.

path_3.feeling: The mischievous chaos entertains in bursts, but the tonal mugging wears thin.

path_3.title: Mystic River (2003)

path_3.feeling: Moved by its grand longing even when the reach feels a bit overextended.

path_3.feeling: Charmed by the craft more than emotionally swept up.

path_5.feeling: Sultry voodoo-noir mood and twisty dread hit my sweet spot.

path_5.title: Omen, The (1976)
path_5.feeling: Atmospheric, slow-burn satanic chills that land more than not.

path_5.title: The Body (2012)
path_5.feeling: Sleek, twisty mystery that kept me guessing.

path_5.feeling: Lush, ponderous romance with moments that work.

path_5.title: Interstellar (2014)
